levels.title: Introduction level
levels.content: Welcome to the KYPO platform. We've prepared training composed of multiple types of levels. In training levels, you need to read an assignment and find an answer to process to the next level.

levels.title: Get Access
levels.cloud_content:
Your first task is to access the sandbox, where you will complete all following tasks. After you have successfully connected, Submit the answer **`start`**.

## Sandbox GUI access

1. Download the SSH access zip file from Training Level of the Linear Training Run page with topology visualization (in case of Adaptive Training Run, download it from the Training Phase).

2. Extract the ssh-access.zip file to the ~/.ssh/ directory:

>> `$ unzip ssh-access.zip -d ~/.ssh/`

> Extracted files:
> 
> >     ~/.ssh/pool-id-ID-sandbox-id-ID-user-config: the SSH configuration file.
> >     ~/.ssh/pool-id-ID-sandbox-id-ID-user-key: the sandbox user SSH private key.
> >     ~/.ssh/pool-id-ID-sandbox-id-ID-user-key.pub: the sandbox user SSH public key.

3. Copy content in the file **`pool-id-ID-sandbox-id-ID-user-config`** to the file **`~/.ssh/config`** (if the file is not exist, create one) 
4. Run this command:

>> `$ ssh -L 5901:localhost:5901 -N -i pool-id-ID-sandbox-id-ID-user-key user@client`

5. Install any VNCviewr (You can refer to this [site](https://linuxhint.com/install-realvnc-vnc-viewer-linux/)) then connect to **`localhost:5901`** with password is "**`password`**"

## Sandbox SSH access
- Do the first 2 step as instruction above. Connect directly to any virtual machine using SSH protocol:

>> `$ ssh -F ~/.ssh/pool-id-ID-sandbox-id-ID-user-config <vm_name>`

>> the **`<vm_name>`** can be **`user@client`** or **`user@server`** or any other.


Alternatively, you can use SSH to connect to the machine. SSH access makes it easier to copy-paste commands and flags, but requires more steps to set up. See [documentation](https://docs.crp.kypo.muni.cz/user-guide-advanced/sandboxes/sandbox-access/#user-access) for more details.
levels.local_content:
Before proceeding further, you need to start a sandbox on your machine. 
Please clone [this Gitlab repository](https://<link_to_a_repo>) and follow steps in the README file.
When your sandbox is ready at your host, submit the passkey from the README file.

levels.title: Connect to FTP server
levels.content:
Did you know that in FTP server they can config so that public user can access files from a remote server without requiring them to identify themselves?
Try to connect to the FTP server using that username and see if there are any interesting files.

The answer for this level is the name of the file in lowercase.

levels.title: Crack the password
levels.content:
Interesting! From the announcement, we know that there is 4 username that is on the server: john, root, jack, david.

hmm... 

We already have the username, now we just need to bruteforce the password, give it a try!

The answer for this level is the **`password`** of the user that you successfully crack.
